sub_title: Sales transformation and productivity at Heineken
summary:
In my career I have been able to see commerce, for the larger part at Heineken, from many different angles. At trade marketing, where I created brand programs for Heineken's clients in the bar and restaurant industry as wel as supporting the sales force with the right insights and tooling to make their visits and conversations as effective and inspiring as possible. 
As  a national account manager myself, where I negotiated with the larger chains in catering and restaurants and helped them grow their business. 
In all functions the digital transformation played a role already, but as a digital and technology manager I was able to accelerate ideas around digitizing the customer's experience with Heineken as well as the way the back-office, wholesaler operation and many processes are organized. Also I gained deeper insights in the complexity of IT and the architecture that is needed to make a digital transformation work.
From a marketing perspective in DR Congo I worked on making local and international brands fit the consumer's need and create experiences that increase brand power.

Overall these different perspectives give me the experience to get a 360 degrees view on commerce and how to make sure sales, (trade marketing) and digital operate harmoniously. However, most of all I learned how to engage people and create the right culture and modus for collaboration. For me, this is the key to succes and more importantly a fulfilling working life.
